prompt: Photorealistic wide shot of a professional Japanese art appraisal in progress. A middle-aged appraiser wearing white gloves leans over a long wooden table, meticulously examining a large antique Japanese hanging scroll (kakejiku) featuring a subtle ink wash landscape. The scroll extends horizontally across the frame. Soft, natural light streams from a large window to the left, illuminating the textures of the silk mounting and washi paper. In the softly blurred background, shelves filled with reference books and archival boxes suggest a scholarly gallery or office setting. Rule of thirds composition, calm and focused atmosphere. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: japanese-art-appraisal-image-1.png

prompt: Hyperrealistic macro shot focusing on a gloved hand holding a vintage brass magnifying glass over a vibrant section of an Edo-period Japanese ukiyo-e woodblock print. The magnified area reveals intricate details of carved lines, bokashi shading, and the texture of the washi paper, perhaps depicting part of a kabuki actor's robe or a detail from Hokusai's wave. The print itself fills the widescreen frame horizontally. Bright, focused task lighting illuminates the magnified section, creating sharp focus and contrast against the slightly darker surroundings. Documentary style, emphasizing detail and scrutiny. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: japanese-art-appraisal-image-2.png

prompt: Wide-angle, photorealistic interior view of a modern, minimalist Japanese art conservation and appraisal lab. A large, clean work table dominates the foreground, upon which rests a single antique celadon ceramic vase under focused examination lighting. The background features meticulously organized shelves holding rolled scrolls in tubes, reference volumes on Asian art, and specialized conservation tools. No people are visible, emphasizing the professional environment and tools of the trade. Bright, even, slightly cool ambient lighting. Architectural digest aesthetic, clean lines, sense of order and expertise. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: japanese-art-appraisal-image-3.png

prompt: Overhead flat lay composition, photorealistic style. An antique Japanese ceramic tea bowl (chawan) with a rich, textured glaze sits on the left side of a dark wooden surface. Beside it, filling the center and right of the 16:9 frame, lies an open, large-format art history reference book displaying high-quality photographs and descriptions of similar pottery. A pair of hands (one gloved) gently rests near the bowl and book, perhaps pointing to a specific detail. Soft, even studio lighting minimizes shadows, ensuring clarity of both the 3D object and the printed page. Scholarly, informative aesthetic. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: japanese-art-appraisal-image-4.png

prompt: Sophisticated close-up shot, photorealistic. An intricately carved antique ivory netsuke rests on a dark velvet cloth in the foreground left. Partially tucked behind it on the right lies a professional appraisal certificate on high-quality paper, with generic letterhead, typed description, and a visible (but slightly blurred) signature and valuation figure. The composition uses shallow depth of field, keeping the netsuke and key parts of the document sharp. Dramatic, focused spotlighting highlights the artwork and the document's value/signature area, creating contrast and emphasizing the finality and importance of the appraisal. Elegant, high-contrast aesthetic. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: japanese-art-appraisal-image-5.png
